tool.name: qiime2 sample-classifier split-table
tool.description: Split a feature table into training and testing sets.

param.name: table
param.label: table: FeatureTable[Frequency¹ | RelativeFrequency² | PresenceAbsence³ | Balance⁴ | PercentileNormalized⁵ | Design⁶]
param.help: [required] Feature table containing all features that should be used for target prediction.

param.name: type
param.label: metadata: MetadataColumn[Numeric | Categorical]
param.help: [required] Numeric metadata column to use as prediction target.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

param.name: test_size
param.label: test_size: Float % Range(0.0, 1.0)
param.help: [default: 0.2] Fraction of input samples to exclude from training set and use for classifier testing.

param.name: random_state
param.label: random_state: Int
param.help: [optional] Seed used by random number generator.

param.name: stratify
param.label: stratify: Bool
param.help: [default: Yes] Evenly stratify training and test data among metadata categories. If True, all values in column must match at least two samples.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: sample-classifier split-table ====================================== Split a feature table into training and testing sets.
Outputs: -------- :training_table.qza: Feature table containing training samples :test_table.qza: Feature table containing test samples :training_targets.qza: Series containing true target values of train samples :test_targets.qza: Series containing true target values of test samples
|
Description: ------------ Split a feature table into training and testing sets. By default stratifies training and test sets on a metadata column, such that values in that column are evenly represented across training and test sets.
|
